title: What are some good, affordable online education that offers bachelor's degrees? - Quora

response.answer_text: Check out University of the People. They have bachelor degrees under $5,000 - you pay what you can so it can be much cheaper than that. Also, if you have time on your hands to complete a lot of course in a 2–6 months then you should check out self-paced competency-based bachelor degrees, which basically allow you to sign up for a specific amount of time (usually 2–6 months) & will allow you to complete as many courses as you’d like. Some examples are John F. Kennedy University’s Flexcourse, 6 months - $4,250. University of Maine at Presque Isle, 2 months - $1,400. Brandman University, 6 months - $3,200. Northern Arizona University, 6 months - $3,000. Western Governors University. Links to each program listed above: University of the People: Tuition-Free, Accredited Online Degree Programs Self Paced Online Degree Programs Affordable Accredited Online Degree Programs [Flat Rate Pricing] - JFKu Online Online Degree Programs | University of Maine at Presque Isle Competency Based Online degrees | Online

Johns Hopkins has an endowment from Michael Bloomberg that reduces the cost of college expenses. Inexpensive Bachelor’s degrees are found at American Public University and other schools. To refine your research: google: reduced tuition for education majors. Include the subject areas of interest to you.
